docs.title: Resilience Biomarkers Field Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the Resilience Biomarkers Field Guide for aquaculture omics data analysis!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This field guide provides practical guidance for discovering and applying resilience biomarkers from multi-omics data in aquaculture research. The guide synthesizes meta-analysis approaches and best practices for identifying molecular signatures that predict organism resilience under various stress conditions.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text:
The primary goals of this field guide are to:

  • Provide practical workflows for analyzing omics data to identify resilience biomarkers
  • Share best practices for integrating multi-omics datasets
  • Document methods for meta-analysis of publicly available aquaculture omics data
  • Support reproducible research with clear methodological guidance

docs.title: Target Audience
docs.text:
This guide is designed for:

  • Aquaculture researchers working with omics data
  • Bioinformaticians analyzing stress response and resilience
  • Graduate students learning multi-omics integration approaches
  • Industry professionals seeking to apply biomarker-based selection strategies

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Read About to learn more about this field guide
  • Check the Structure page to understand how content is organized
  • Explore individual chapters (coming soon) for specific methodologies

docs.title: Related Resources
docs.text:
• Main Project Website
  • Publications
  • Analysis Notebook
  • GitHub Repository

This field guide is actively developed as part of the Resilience Biomarkers for Aquaculture project.

docs.title: What is the Resilience Biomarkers Field Guide?
docs.text: The Resilience Biomarkers Field Guide is a comprehensive resource for discovering and validating biomarkers of resilience in aquaculture species using omics data. This guide bridges the gap between theoretical concepts and practical application, providing researchers with actionable workflows and methodologies.

docs.title: Scope
docs.text: This field guide covers:

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text:
• Public omics databases and repositories
  • Experimental design considerations for stress studies
  • Data quality assessment and preprocessing

docs.title: Analytical Approaches
docs.text:
• Transcriptomics analysis workflows
  • Proteomics data integration
  • Metabolomics profiling
  • Multi-omics integration strategies

docs.title: Biomarker Discovery
docs.text:
• Statistical approaches for identifying candidate biomarkers
  • Validation strategies
  • Meta-analysis methods for cross-study integration
  • Prioritization frameworks

docs.title: Application
docs.text:
• Biomarker-assisted selection in breeding programs
  • Environmental monitoring and early warning systems
  • Resilience assessment tools

docs.title: Development and Maintenance
docs.text:
This field guide is:

  • Open and collaborative: Contributions and feedback are welcome
  • Living documentation: Regularly updated with new methods and findings
  • Evidence-based: Grounded in published research and validated approaches
  • Reproducible: Includes code examples and detailed protocols where applicable

docs.title: How to Use This Guide
docs.text:
The field guide is organized into chapters covering different aspects of biomarker discovery and application. Each chapter includes:

  • Background and context
  • Step-by-step methodologies
  • Best practices and common pitfalls
  • Example datasets and code (where applicable)
  • References to primary literature

You can navigate through the guide using the navigation menu, or use the search functionality to find specific topics.

docs.title: Citation
docs.text:
If you use this field guide in your research, please cite:

Wanamaker, S.A. (2025). Resilience Biomarkers Field Guide. Resilience Biomarkers for Aquaculture Project. https://resilience-biomarkers-for-aquaculture.github.io/field-guide/

docs.title: Contact and Contributions
docs.text:
• Report issues: Use the GitHub issue tracker
  • Suggest improvements: Submit a pull request or open an issue
  • Questions: Open a discussion on the GitHub repository

docs.title: Acknowledgments
docs.text:
This field guide is developed as part of the Resilience Biomarkers for Aquaculture project, which aims to improve oyster aquaculture sustainability through omics-based biomarker discovery.

Last updated: January 2025

docs.title: Content Organization
docs.text: This field guide is organized into thematic chapters that build upon each other, though each chapter can also serve as a standalone resource.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Home: Overview and introduction to the field guide
  • About: Detailed information about the guide's scope and purpose
  • Structure: This page - explaining how content is organized

docs.title: Planned Chapters
docs.text: The following chapters are in development and will be added progressively:

docs.title: How to Navigate
docs.text:
• Use the navigation menu on the left to browse chapters
  • Use the search function to find specific topics
  • Follow cross-references between chapters for related content
  • Check back regularly as new chapters are added

docs.title: Contributing to Structure
docs.text:
If you have suggestions for additional chapters or reorganization of content:

  1. Open an issue on the GitHub repository
  2. Provide rationale for the suggested changes
  3. Indicate if you'd like to contribute content

This structure is subject to evolution as the field guide develops.
